breathtakingly beautiful and extremely varied there are plenty of destinations that are ideal for visiting with kids every country has its own amazing places to explore from rainforests and mountain ranges to incredible wildlife coffee plantations ancient cities and golden beaches a family vacation in south america will expose every member of the family to intriguing new things be they flora landscapes food history fauna or culture holidays here are south american adventure tours where fun filled days are packed with new and educational experiences for everyone read on to discover more about this fascinating vacation destination this post may contain affiliate links from which we would earn a small commission at no extra cost to you more info in my disclaimer weve been traveling in latin america for over 20 years and have traveled extensively in south america with kids in making our recommendations for world travel with kids we are considering that you will be traveling with school age children eg probably 6 years upward through to the early teens not that we have experienced the teenage years but we assume that in the teenage years young people can do much of what their parents do and so it is not as necessary to only look at family friendly options our last trip was with a teenager aged 13 as well as my other children aged 10 and 4 so i have now got some experience on what it is like to travel with older kids and those who might be physically capable of things but dont want to eyeroll anyone when you are travelling with teens i think that my standard advice becomes more relevant involve your children in the planning of the trip and make them active participants in the decision making show them photos or youtube videos or if they are old enough get them to search best things to do in buenos aires for teens or whatever city you are going to get their thoughts and do your best to incorporate them we did this as much as was feasible and as a result my kids were happy with our activities most of the time while its nice to have activities that are good for the whole family its sometimes not possible and negotiation works a treat if you are traveling with younger kids eg younger than 6 we consider peru and costa rica in central america to be the most suitable for those with younger children make sure you read ourperu with kids guidefor all the info you need for countries that we have not yet visited with children i reached out to a couple of other travel bloggers for their thoughts and advice to travel to south america as a family is to embark on an adventure like no other there are so many countries to choose from before you even begin would you pick peru where you canvisit machu picchu with kidsand see the sacred valley and cusco or perhaps you would prefer the lake district of chile or the lively historic colombia whether you want to explore the amazon marvel at the majestic iguazu falls experience the surreal landscape of the atacama desert take a trip into patagonia or party in a brazilian city south america will provide plenty of fun intrigue and adventure for every member of your family looking for a exotic costa rica trip then consider ourfamily vacation guide to central america what makes for the best family vacation south america has to offer really does depend on the family itself meaning the individuals who make up that family for one person sampling freshly prepared peruvian street food might be a particular highlight for others their best memory may consist of a day spent on a picture perfect beach will it be jungle trekking in the amazon for you that moment you spotted an exotic bird in the trees above or a visit to a colombian coffee growing zone the issue of safety varies by country and region in some areas acclimatization will be your biggest concern while in others you should consider and minimize the risk of contracting tropical diseases before you travel thosetrekking the inca trail with kidsor visiting cusco can take steps to assist with acclimatization if the peruvian jungle features on your itinerary then its wise to take precautions against contracting malaria or yellow fever weve looked at safety in south america extensively based on 2025 us travel advice and the global peace index discover thesafest countries in south americain our guide always check your countrys latest foreign travel advice before traveling too you canview the us travel advisories here you may also find oursouth america with kids tips guideuseful exploring the huge continent of south america promises a thrilling adventure that your family will never forget you could explore the ancient ruins of peru and the amazing wildlife of the galapagos islands south america has an incredible variety of landscapes wildlife cultures and cuisines to delight all ages here are thebest places for a family vacation in south america we are very fond of peru it is extremely well organized for tourism and is one of the top family vacation spots in south america with just two weeks you can truly see some iconic sites including both machu picchu one of the seven wonders of the world and thesacred valley although we are biased because we lived there for many years cusco also makes a great child friendly base the city was our home for a number of years make sure you read everything you need to know about visitingcusco with kidshereas well as the famous sights of machu picchu and the sacred valley we recommend arequipa andperus south coast with kids the main health concern in the cusco and machu picchu region is acclimatization we have had a lot of experience with this read here for ourtips for acclimatizing to altitude with kids to discover everything you need to know about visiting peru with family make sure you read our peru family vacation guide and peru with kids post must see places for your peru family vacation plus faqs pro tips and more as i mentioned earlier i lived in cusco for many years where i co founded the adventure trekking agencyapus peru a company that grew from a love of the andes and a belief in responsible travel we specialize in trekking and tours in the andes and sacred valley offering classic routes and off the beaten path options with an emphasis on more authentic less crowded experiences and responsible sustainable tourismweve used our personal experience traveling in peru with childrento craft the ultimate itineraries you can discover thefamily tours apus offers here to explore all the highlights of peru the best of peru tour 12 days11 nights is the best family peru tour out there includes lima chichubamba cusco machu picchu and much moreview the full itinerary here with tours running in a huge range of destinations from cusco to lima and even machu picchu colca canyon and arequipa we can tailor the ideal trip to peru for your familycontact us for more info weve done it many times with kids of all ages and stages learn from our experiences altitude alpacas trekking tantrums packing and the amazon jungle emails will be sent by apus peru my travel company its still advice directly from ariana thats me weve just sent you your 6 genius tips for travelling to peru explore all trips the amazon rainforest spreads through bolivia brazil colombia ecuador and peru typically you will need from 3 days to a week to make the most of the amazon surely the mightiest of jungles and home to the breathtakingly awe inspiring amazon river most amazon trips can be added to other holidays mentioned here especially machu picchu and typically last from 3 to 7 days the more time you can spend the more you will get out of the trip for all amazon jungle holidays with children you should consider the malaria considerations take a look at ourtraveling and the risk of malaria in kids we can personally recommend the tambopata region in peru which is easily accessible from cusco the journey to iquitos is also a fascinating one and will require a fair amount of river travel along the way should that be appealing to you better for older kids we highly recommend you base yourself atrefugio amazonasit is ideal for families with a dedicated childrens area and hands on activities through the wired amazon citizen science program what we like about the tambopata region of the amazon is that it can easily be combined with a trip to cusco with nearly all flights making a stopover in cusco before flying onto puerto maldonado there are also a number of lodges that have programs specially designed for childrenposada amazonasis also a great option for a stay with kids alternatively reach out to me onsocialsor email as posada amazonas has three different lodges i can recommend which suits your kids best depending on their age we recently returned from a visit to one of the posada amazonas lodges so i can give great recs whether youd like to visit the biodiverse tambopata reserve near puerto maldonado the remote manu national park or the riverfront lodges near iquitos we can help you plan the ideal itinerary for your time budget and interestsdiscover more here iquitos is most certainly a romantic sounding place landlocked in the heart of the amazon many jungle tours especially those in the more pristine jungle require a decent amount of river travel to arrive at the lodge we also recommend spending at least one night in iquitos if you can its got a unique frontier feel and the river port is not only vibrant but eye opening for families we have been recommended thetahuayo lodgeand their tahuayo river amazon research center to give the kids a bit of a buzz they also have the longest zip line in the amazon south america family holidays are best begun in buenos aires theres a lot to keep everyone busy for a few days including plenty of educational and interactive experiences at the citys childrens museums and parks argentina is a huge country with so much to see and do for a first time family visit wed focus on buenos aires which has enough to captivate for more than a few days a visit to colorful caminito in la boca with its brightly colored buildings and enjoying the tango is a must you can even take tango classes also for any aspiring maradonas a visit to the boca juniors stadium is essential alternatively you could head to the river plate stadium for those more inspired by eva peron and famous historical figures a visit to the casa rosada and recoleta cemetery is a must high on our bucket list is also taking a gaucho argentinian cowboy tour to learn more about this unique argentinian subculture we are already in the process of planning our 2026 trip to south america and argentina is very high on our bucket list with my daughter who will be 16 putting the gaucho cowboy high on her wish list here is a greatlist of parks in buenos aires for those with smaller children if you had more time for south america family holidays in argentina wed also explore salta and mendoza we are totally inspired to visit argentine patagonia after hearing from fellow travel blogger melissa ofthe family voyage patagonia is one of those bucket list destinations however most families assume its not an accessible vacation for them to take with young children the great news is that argentine patagonia is very manageable if expensive with kids we visited when our kids were 35 and 6 i would not recommend taking kids younger than that patagonia is enormous so theres a lot of travel involved plus long days of hiking trails and other excursions see a sampleitinerary for patagonia with kids bus travel in the region is very affordable and high quality but some rides can last up to 24 hours for those long distances we opted for flights despite the relatively high cost we saved by only renting a car for one of our three stops in patagonia our favorite experience in patagonia and maybe the world was trekking in el chalten its a unique little village nestled in the mountains of southern argentina and its truly a hikers paradise theres no cell service and many businesses only take cash its a great place to disconnect from the outside world the bus route to el chalten from the larger city of el calafate drops you right in the village where you can walk to all of the accommodations restaurants gear shops and trailheads most of the trails are pretty rugged but there are many options that offer a good stopping point part of the way up and are reasonable for our active 6 year old to tackle while his younger sister rides in a backpack carrier some kids may not be willing or able to handle that intensity of hiking until closer to 8 be sure to know your kids limits before embarking on the trip for kids who arent up for miles and miles of daily hiking theyll definitely enjoy an up close visit to the penguins ofpeninsula valdes this area is near puerto madryn on the atlantic coast in northern patagonia it has a completely different feel than the rest of the region if you are adventurous we truly believe it makes for one of the best family vacations south america has to offer of all the latin american countries we have visited chile would have to be one of the most kid friendly destinations to explore chileans love children and little ones are treasured you will find the staff at hotels restaurants and attractions keen to help with anything you need chile is a safe country in latin america and has diverse regions with attractions suitable for kids of different ages if you are visiting with kids for the first time you could find plenty ofthings to do in santiagoto fill up a week or more santiago has lots of attractions designed for kids such as fantasilandia amusement park for adrenaline rides and a kids zone for younger children and mirador interactive museum which has science displays and exhibits to keep young minds occupied if your kids are artistic be sure to visit artequin so they can participate in creative hands on arts and crafts activities another activity the kids will love is riding the funicular in santiago metropolitan park there is also an adventure park with a climbing wall suspension bridges and a zip line then theres the santiago planetarium which also has an excellent astronomical park if your kids are older perhaps they will enjoy going horse riding in the andes santiago is also a fantastic place to go with kids in winter there are many ski resorts you can visit as a day trip the largest ski resort in south america valle nevado and the continents oldest portillo are good spots for a family skiing or snowboarding vacation keep an eye out for free or significantly reduced admission rates to events and performances the downside of traveling with kids in chile is that public toilets are not always clean it pays to carry toilet paper soap and hand sanitizer with a little preparation chile can be one of the best family vacations in south america christinatravel2nextcom ecuador and the galapagos are some of the best places to visit in south america with kids this can be one of those bucket list once in a lifetime holidays so wed recommend this for when the children reach double figures or beyond ecuador offers one of the crown jewels of incredible wildlife experiences in our experience a trip to the galapagos is truly a trip of a lifetime and will make a wonderful family vacation in south america weve researched such a trip thoroughly and decided to wait until our kids are about 10 12 years old our reasons are eminently practical we want them to be safe and responsible on board a boat and have great swimming skills finally we want the kids to fully appreciate what they are seeing galapagos cruises at least those that are responsible ethical and environmentally conscientious dont come cheaply however more recently weve read that if you dont want to take kids on a cruise you can base yourself on one of the islands such as santa cruz island and make day trips this sounds like a much better option and is explained comprehensively ingalapagos islands with kids in addition quito is a charming capital city it is also a great base for exploring nearby indigenous markets hiking or even volcano climbing we cant wait to explore the lush green mountains of ecuador with the children especially the gorgeous town ofbanos famous for its hot baths another beautiful and educational destination in ecuador is the city ofcuenca in the southern highlands ecuador and the galapagos islands are definitely a great destination for a family adventure holiday however we would opt for our kids being slightly older when people think of brazil they imagine a party destination with lots of carnival and samba however brazil is a fascinating and family friendly vacation destination for one the wildlife is diverse children can have the time of their lives spotting wild animals in their natural habitat at praia do forno one of the prettiestbrazilian beaches you can go on a fun boat trip to spot whales and sea turtles in the region the bird species that dive for food are also incredible for two the flora is impressively majestic and unique most major cities have botanical gardens with towering trees and interesting colorful plant species your kids have probably never seen before the rio de janeiro and the curitiba botanical gardens are two lovely green areas where children can learn and see so much while the curitiba garden is more about plants the rio de janeiro garden is a great place to spot marmosets turtles toucans and small parrots my niece and nephew 5 and 3 we ecstatic from seeing those animals last but not least brazil has an incredible collection of kid friendly museums that most tourists are not aware of south american african european and brazilian art and culture are showcased in many institutions around the country from brazils history to soccer and more children can learn a lot on this vacation bruna fromi heart brazil uruguay is the perfect destination to visit in south america with kids not only is uruguay the 2nd safest country in south america to visit according to the world peace index 2025 but its also the perfect place for a family vacation or you can do a day or overnight trip to uruguay from buenos aires and get another stamp in their passports thats what we are intending to do in 2026 a must visit colonia del sacramento this unesco world heritage site with its cobblestone streets quaint old buildings and vintage cars is like stepping back in time make sure you visit the lighthouse which offers panoramic views of the town and the river if your family loves wildlife consider heading to punta del este for a boat trip to see the playful sea lions on isla de lobos the town is also known for its beautiful beaches such as playa mansa and playa brava and the fascinating sculpture of la mano the hand for a real off the beaten path experience venture inland to the gaucho uruguayan cowboy country in towns like tacuaremb√≥ and durazno you can visit estancias ranches where your family can learn about the gaucho lifestyle and even try horse riding from historical sites to natural wonders and lively towns to tranquil countryside uruguay is a family friendly destination that caters to all tastes and ages bogota is the ideal place to start a colombian adventure cable cars and colonial architecture are among its charms other musts include the medellin coffee growing zone cartagena and the beaches of santa marta taganga or playa blanca on colombias caribbean sea sure colombia was once the home of narcos the farc and all kinds of kidnappings however it is also the home of some of the warm hearted and lively people in the americas also not to mention beautiful landscapes and rich history colombia is definitely a place to add to your south america for kids bucket list mumma traveler made several trips to colombia during the 2000s where she was privileged to explore various parts of this stunning country that is why she is adding it to this list of family adventure holidays without a doubt colombia is a place that will inspire the adventurous travel familys wanderlust if you are looking at travel warnings issued by your country for colombia it looks a bit alarming with large amounts of area listed as reconsider your need to travel however if you read the detail areas commonly visited by tourists are safe with a exercise caution at all times eg these beautiful places are all in red zones but the cities are considered safe i actually travelled by bus between many of these areas back in 2004 and had no issues but in 2026 when we visit with my kids i will be flying between cities bogota with its truly amazing gold museum cable car and colonial architecture is a good place to start your exploration we were super excited to have visited in 2023 with kids aged 4 9 and 13 as a result of that 2023 trip and how much the kids felt comfortable in bogota we have all put a 2026 colombia trip on our south america bucket list likely alongside argentina and of course peru assuming that you only have 2 or 3 weeks after bogot√° wed explore the coffee growing zone around medell√≠n we loved visiting salento and manizales and used medellin as a gateway while in medellin dont miss the botero artworks or thepablo escobar museum in the north of colombiacartagenais a must for a few days for its old world charm without a doubt one of my favorite cities in the world take a look at this great guide ofwhere to stay in cartagena from there you can either head to the beautiful beaches of playa blanca or across to taganga central america has incredible natural beauty including child friendly costa rica a compact country full of gorgeous beaches jungle and wildlife well be spending some time there this year and literally cant wait theres mexico which we once visited with a 4 month old the underwater cenotes are not to be missed we also knownicaraguawell the highlights include the colonial cities of leon and granada the unspoiled coast of san juan del sur and the volcanic island of ometepe for full details of central america with kids please check out our companion post detailing the best central american family vacation destinations use the interactive map below to explore our recommended destinations for family trips to south america so it might not be your first thought for a successful family vacation however for those adventurous families that take onsouth america with kids they will be amply rewarded with amazing insight into a range of latin cultures history and some really amazing food south america really has it all and is an amazing adventure family travel destination if youd like help crafting a kid friendly itinerary for peru apus can tailor your itinerary depending on your kids ages energy levels and budget if youre traveling with little ones we highly recommend peru other countries highly recommended include chile argentina and uruguay among others the amazon which covers multiple south american countries is also a must visit south america is a huge continent and each country has its own time to visit for example perus dry season may sept is popular patagonia is best dec feb amazon is year round with seasonal differences peru is by far the best country in south america to visit with kids and its perfect for first time visitors too explore the sacred valley and machu picchu discover the peruvian amazon and spend time in cities like cusco and lima theres so much history culture and wildlife to explore youll be spoilt for choice two weeks is enough to see the highlights of one country but south america also has many other safe countries you could add to your itinerary you could spend years exploring this diverse continent if you stay three weeks you could add a second destination like the amazon or the gal√°pagos generally peru argentina and parts of colombia are the best value youll find most countriesdestinations in south america are cheaper than those in the uswestern countries although you may find parts of uruguay and the gal√°pagos a splurge like it pin it a guide to the best family vacation south america with kids like it share it comment name email website you are a font of information on south american travel with kids and i love how youve compacted it all in to this resourceful guide one day we will make it there with our boys fearlessfamtrav this is such a useful guide well be heading to central and south america next year as part of a six month trip from alaska to argentina ive pinned your post for later so that i can really take the time to work through it and check out your other related posts thank you fearlessfamtrav you really are the font of all knowledge on travelling south america with kids will definitely be coming your way when we plan our south american adventure thanks for joining fearlessfamtrav this time around i think latin america has more beautiful destinations in terms of natural beauty rather than north or south you can see more open spaces and national parks in latin america there are quiet peaceful countries out there thanks mate for this great post i really appreciate [] if you plan on heading on to south america or just want more information read our a guide to the best family vacation south america with kids [] there are many places in the amazon rainforest that are suitable for kids for example the amazon rainforest spreads through bolivia brazil colombia ecuador and peru while weve visited and absolutely solo travel destinations in south americ.page_title: My Experience Backpacking Solo in Asia ‚Äì Travel Guru Destinations
solo travel destinations in south americ.description: 5 lessons learned while backpacking Asia as a solo female traveler. Check out my South East Asia trip highlights and recommended country stops along the way!
solo travel destinations in south americ.content_preview: have you ever imaged yourself backpacking south east asia taking a solo trip across the world staying at a backpacker hostel or having the complete freedom to wake up and dowhatever you wanted to do yeah me too when i graduated from the university of texas at san antonio in 2016 i felt ready to take...
solo travel destinations in south americ.full_content: have you ever imaged yourself backpacking south east asia taking a solo trip across the world staying at a backpacker hostel or having the complete freedom to wake up and dowhatever you wanted to do yeah me too when i graduated from the university of texas at san antonio in 2016 i felt ready to take over the world and excited to start adulting however before i started my career in business operations for a tech company i convinced myself thata solo trip to south east asiawas my destiny i worked really hard to save my money and go on this trip as a graduation present to myself it was the best decision i could have made at the time this article will walk you throughthe cities i visited in 6 asian countries and the 5 lessons i learnedthroughout my journey this was before i knew much abouttravel hacks and tips for long term traveli wish i knewthen what i knownowto have traveled smarter but better late than never check out the linked post to read about my travel tips so you can travel smart too so back to my last months in school i had the opportunity to study abroad for a fifth and last time in japan to complete one final course for my degree my journey with utsa took me to tokyo osaka and kyoto i fell in love with japan after spending a few weeks there i attended a tea ceremony cheered on at a sumo wrestler match fed macaque monkeys at arashiyama watched the sun set through a bamboo grove forest went to the robot and maid cafes spent a day at tokyo disney sea and much much more if youre planning a trip to japan ill be happy to give you my personal recommendations i provide atravel planningto take your pre planning stress away it doesnt hurt to ask youll be surprised the good things that can come out of it if you simply ask the questions to turn a wild thought into reality this is how i managed to start my solo journey after my study abroad program and after waving goodbye to my study abroad university group i jumped on a plane to spend a few island days in okinawa japan before traveling by myself to south east asia and yes i tried the habu sake wine from the picture above x i recorded a podcast episode on limitless living about my 2 month journey traveling through asia click below to listen these were the following stops along my journey okinawa japan ho chi minh city vietnam phnom penh cambodia siem reap cambodia bangkok thailand singapore bali indonesia i have a million memories and i learned invaluable life lessons while traveling alone for two months i truly recommend this once in a lifetime experience to anyone it can sound scary but the experience is worth taking the chance first stop after japan wasvietnam i had quite an interesting experience in ho chi minh city that involves fake taxis cancelled hotel stays and ruthless motorbikes for the full story listen onsoundcloud my tourist money can make a difference in the lives of the local people for 20 days i traveled throughcambodiawith intrepid and i was paired with channa my local tour guide who shared her country with us she proudly shared much about cambodias history and culture and took us to amazing places including angkor wat my experience traveling with her changed the way i travel now in new places i look for nonprofit restaurants stay at airbnbs and support local merchants as much as i can friends of friends are the friends you didnt know you had inthailand i roamed local markets visited hole in the wall restaurants and had a private tour through the city because my friend at home connected me with her thai friends i learned to travel like a local thanks to them im a representation of my own country i better make a good impression while grabbing sunset drinks at the top of the boat at the marina bay sands hotel insingapore im told by someone that im the first mexican girl theyve ever met what an honor to represent mexico and share my customs and traditions with someone way across the world i learned that its good for you to disconnect from the world this meant some days without my phone computer wifi and more time with myselfindonesiadid not disappoint my time in south east asia was special and i cant wait to return one day for a full video on my trip check out my youtube videoadventures in asia whether you are alonetraveling with your partner with family or friends traveling to the other side of the world to live life in a way so different from yours is a life changing experience are you considering taking a solo trip after reading this articlemessage meto tell me about it signed while inperu check out the blog post here salma travel guru do you want to travel and dont know where to start contact mefor help planning your next trip an overview of my asian adventure Œ¥ attravelgurudestinations a post shared by salma travel guru attravelgurudestinations contact me collaborations privacy policy

digital nomad friendly cities.page_title: Best American Cities for Digital Nomads ‚Äì Mark's Travel Journal
digital nomad friendly cities.description: The US is more and more attractive to digital nomads from all over the world. Check out some of the best American cities for digital nomads!
digital nomad friendly cities.content_preview: travel experience digital nomadism is becoming a greater trend than ever more and more people are working remotely whats more theyre finding it enjoyable and far less stressful not only can they work from the comfort of their home but they can also choose where their home will be becoming a digital ...
digital nomad friendly cities.full_content: travel experience digital nomadism is becoming a greater trend than ever more and more people are working remotely whats more theyre finding it enjoyable and far less stressful not only can they work from the comfort of their home but they can also choose where their home will be becoming a digital nomad offers you unique geographical freedom and the opportunity to explore many different places in the world as long as you have a good internet connection you can do your job from any country in the world among the countries that are gaining popularity is the us this expansive country offers a variety of landscapes lifestyles and opportunities from paradise like beaches or charming quiet towns to vibrant urban centers theres something to suit every taste and preference so before you pack your bags check out the best american cities for digital nomads its no wonder that orlando florida is one of the best american cities for digital nomads fantastic weather and amazing beaches provide a perfect opportunity to balance work with pleasure after all who doesnt dream of working while enjoying the sun and occasionally dipping into the ocean apart from the appeal of constant vacation orlando boasts excellent high tech and educational markets ideal for the digital nomad lifestyle additionally you can opt for tourism related work opportunities there are plenty of tourist andkid friendly attractionsin orlando if youre moving with a family dont miss out on walt disney world chocolate kingdom and seaworld whether you enjoy music art or diverse cuisine austin is the right place for you plentiful co working spaces lively job market high salaries and budget friendly cost of living make austin the number one spot for digital nomads from all over the world young and fresh entrepreneurial spirit and numerous tech startups are the main attraction to people starting their careers plus there is a lot to do in your free time the live music capital of the world has it all from world class museums and sculpture gardens to live music venues and exquisite restaurants in addition to that if youre passionate about hiking and other outdoor activities austin is a perfect match for you it boasts numerous parks nature preserves and hiking trails the big apple is not only considered to be one of the major urban centers in the us but in the world this vibrant city provides ample job opportunities to digital nomads on top of the excellent options for co working spaces meetups and cafes there is a lot to do and explore in your free time the city that never sleeps boasts a rich cultural scene and dynamic nightlife there are plenty of museums galleries and iconic attractions you can visit not to mention you can take part in numerous outdoor activities pursuing your hobbies and passions will enable you to meet like minded people and build your social network naturally finding yourself in a new city alone in unfamiliar surroundings can be daunting in the beginning however finding a perfect home in nyc and adding a personal touch after moving in will help you feel better set up your home office paint the walls to your liking andcozy up the place quickly soon it will feel like a home away from home youll be ready to meet new people and enjoy your new life to the fullest located close to los angeles this enchanting city offers both a thriving market for digital nomads and a laid back lifestyle it provides ample job opportunities in entertainment publishing fitness technology and many other sectors plus soaking in the sun at the beach or exploring the city by bike are great ways to entertain your free hours water sports outdoor activities and delicious cuisine make santa monica an excellent place for enthusiastic digital nomads santa monica pier venice beach over thirty art galleries and santa monica food walk theres always something new to try out in this coastal city this mysterious and charming city has a lot more to offer than mardi gras whether youre looking for work in healthcare finance transportation oil and energy or defense new orleans is a perfect destination there are many global companies that create an alluring international atmosphere all of that makes new orleans one of the best american cities for digital nomads not to mention that the big easy is famous for its colorful history and cultural diversity you can enjoy live jazz venues and festivals or cruising down the mississippi and exploring the garden district there is a lot to do and see in this beautiful city of course we could not but talk about new orleanss rich cuisine dont miss jambalaya beignets gumbo or amazing cheese boards that allcheese loverswill relish while all these places seem tempting its important to consider all factors before making a decision an adventurous spirit and itchy feet are great but there are practical issues you need to think about having somevaluable guidelines for living and working abroadwill enable you to make the right choice which nomad friendly destination you choose will depend on many factors for example think about what kind of job youre looking for your income as well as your preferences here are some essentials to consider when choosing one of the best cities in the us starting a digital nomad career is exciting and challenging at the same time there are so many wonderful places in the world that it seems challenging to choose where to go for that reason its essential to consider your career options and job opportunities as well as all other factors the us is home to many global companies and has a dynamic job market not to mention all the breathtaking views welcoming cities and diverse and rich culture so check out these american cities for digital nomads and find the one that suits your lifestyle i have been to new york before and i can see the appeal i want to visit the rest hopefully one day as a digital nomad myself x ive always wanted to visit texas and nyc i dont know if i am a digital nomad yet hopefully in the future i can be thanks for sharing it is a kind of dream of mine to be a digital nomad and spend time in nyc its good to know that its a place where this is possible thanks for sharing wasnt texas unable to provide power to the majority of its own state due to privatisation of the power grid and an unwillingness to pay to protect it from the weather that doesnt seem like an ideal place to be a digital nomad if you cant be sure the power will stay on yes it was far from ideal when they had there power problem big lesson learned and being addressed every texan would happily tell you its a great place to visit and live that was definitely be living the dream being a digital nomad in one of these cities i love new york mostly because im a huge musical theatre fan but i also think id love to live in austin too both great destinations and choices thanks for the comments pingbacktop cities for expats in the us where to live and why marks travel journal Œ¥ enter your email address to follow this blog and receive notifications of new posts by email email address digital nomad friendly cities.page_title: What is the safest country in South America? ‚Äì Travel Guru Destinations
digital nomad friendly cities.description: Mountainside thermal waters, award winning wine regions, UNESCO heritage sites, ski resorts in the Andes‚Ä¶ did you know Chile is the safest country according to the 2019 global peace index?
digital nomad friendly cities.content_preview: as you may know ive spent the last year living and traveling throughout different countries in south america a year ago i asked myself a million questions wheres the best city to live in as a digital nomad which cities should i visit most importantly whats the safest place to visit in south america ...
digital nomad friendly cities.full_content: as you may know ive spent the last year living and traveling throughout different countries in south america a year ago i asked myself a million questions wheres the best city to live in as a digital nomad which cities should i visit most importantly whats the safest place to visit in south america i can now speak on this topic from my own personal experience i have some statistics for you to back up my answer as im being as non biased as possible i hope you learn something new from this if we look at official numbers the2019 global peace indexrankschilesafer than the rest of the countries in south america and also the rest of the americas the global peach index takes into consideration a countrys violence and it is an attempt to measure the relative position of nations peacefulness for perspective ill provide the ranks of well known countries from most peaceful to leastrank 1 icelandrank 20 norwayrank 27 chilerank 33 costa ricarank 75 argentinarank 60 francerank 128 united states of america sourcehttpvisionofhumanityorgappuploads201907gpi 2019webpdf for a broader overview this is a snapshot of the global peace index in all of the americas have you learned something new from this now after living incolombiaperu chile and argentina throughout 2019 i can share with you our comments in regards to safety in south america we lived in santiago the capital of chile for 3 months the cost of living there was higher than in bogota lima and buenos aires we also found a significant number of expats living there from the us australia united kingdom japan you name it chilean spanish is quite fast and they use a lot of slang it can be quite difficult to understand until you get a little bit more used to it from santiago you can visit the pacific coast valparaiso the desertic north san pedro de atacama and the patagonian south for example puerto montttorres del painepunta arenas chile has sooo much to offer as far as diverse landscapes and big city getaways id say its an underrated country that might slip past your radar if you dont know much about it i create custom travel itineraries in chile and to over45 countries using my personal experiences to help you travel and explore more wine tasting at concha y toro cousino macul vineyards ski school in farellones in mid july the seasons are flipped in the southern hemisphere thermal waters in the andes mountains its such an incredible feeling i really hope that after reading this you consider adding chile to your bucket list this bah√°√¨ house of worship is 1 of 7 in the world one in every continent this one sits proudly above santiago chile i travel to see unique places all over the world üíô why do you want to travel casa de adoraci√≥n de sudam√©rica s√≥lo se encuentra uno en cada continente uniqueworldtravel alwaysgivethanks traveler a post shared bysalma travel guruattravelgurudestinations onmay 14 2019 at 640pm pdt signed after digital nomad friendly cities.page_title: Top Cities for Expats in the US: Where to Live and Why ‚Äì Mark's Travel Journal
digital nomad friendly cities.description: Discover top cities for expats in the US. Explore career opportunities and lifestyles in these diverse destinations.
digital nomad friendly cities.content_preview: travel experience welcome to our guide on the top cities for expats in the us moving to a new city is a significant decision especially in a foreign country the choice of where to live can shape your entire experience from your career opportunities to your overall quality of life in this guide well ...
digital nomad friendly cities.full_content: travel experience welcome to our guide on the top cities for expats in the us moving to a new city is a significant decision especially in a foreign country the choice of where to live can shape your entire experience from your career opportunities to your overall quality of life in this guide well explore cities that have become magnets for expatriates seeking diverse landscapes career growth and a taste of american culture whether youre a tech enthusiast eyeing silicon valley in san francisco or dreaming of a sunny lifestyle in miami here you will find important information to help you make an informed decision new york city a metropolis that needs no introduction is a prime destination for expats in the us its appeal lies in the sheer diversity of opportunities it offers with a job market as vast as the city expats can explore careers in finance fashion media and technology even if you are adigital nomad nyc can offer plenty of options the citys cultural attractions are various ensuring something for everyone new york citys energy is infectious andits a city that never sleeps nyc is your playground if youre ready to embrace the fast pace and diversity of experiences therefore whether you dream of wall street or broadway this city offers a stage for your ambitions the citys global outlook welcomes expats worldwide enriching your personal and professional journey this vibrant city offers a blend of opportunities and lifestyle thats hard to resist no wonder it is a rising star among cities for expats in the us at the heart of austins appeal is its booming tech scene often dubbed silicon hills tech enthusiasts will find a haven here with countless startups and tech giants setting up shop the citys laid back atmosphere encourages a work life balance that many expats cherish as you prepare to move remember that austins culinary scene is a treat from food trucks to upscale dining its a foodies paradise anddont forget to explore the local music scene austin is the live music capital of the world with its beautiful parks and hiking trails austin invites you to enjoy nature barton springs pool an oasis in the citys heart is a must visit to beat the texas heat austins growth in population and opportunities makes it an exciting city for expats seeking a blend of tech innovation culture and natural beauty orlando florida might not be the first city that comes to mind when considering cities for expats in the us but its a hidden gem with unique offerings key factors that make orlando florida so valuable are while orlando may not be as bustling as other cities its unique charm and growing job market make it an attractive option for expats looking for a family friendly and vibrant environment whether pursuing a tourism healthcare or technology career orlando offers a dynamic backdrop for your expat journey regarding expats moving to washington dc this city often takes the top spot on their list the nations capital is a dynamic hub offering a wealth of opportunities expatriates are drawn to dc because ofits diverse job market international organizations tech companiesand more whether youre an aspiring diplomat or a tech savvy professional this city has something for you moving to a new country can be a daunting task for expats however if youhave the help of overseas movers it can ease the transition they specialize in facilitating international relocations handling logistics and ensuring a smooth move to dc with the right support you can focus on settling into this thriving city and exploring it while still in the process of relocating as you move to washington dc consider its rich history cultural offerings and the opportunity to network with professionals worldwide dc provides a gateway to a world of possibilities for expats seeking diverse landscapes and career growth choosing among the cities for expats in the us is more than just a geographical shift its a life altering decision that should align with your personal interests budget and career aspirations first and foremost consider your interests are you a culture enthusiast who thrives in the hustle and bustle of a big city or do you prefer a slower pace having the time tomeet the local communityand proximity to nature budget is another pivotal factorevaluate the cost of living including housing transportation and daily expenseswhile some cities might offer higher salaries they often come with elevated costs make sure your budget aligns with your desired quality of life lastly job opportunities play a significant role research your fields demand in each city and the potential for career growth your professional journey should flourish in your chosen destination ultimately the decision is personaland about creating a life that suits your preferences and ambitions weigh your options carefully explore each citys offerings and confidently embark on this exciting expat adventure the united states offers a variety of opportunities and experiences for expats with each of these cities carving out its unique niche in the grand mosaic whether you seek a thriving career a vibrant cultural scene or a warm family friendly environment one of these cities could be your perfect fit so take the time to research connect with local expat communities and make your decision wisely we hope this guide has been a valuable resource in your journey toward finding your new home in the cities for expats in the us Œ¥ enter your email address to follow this blog and receive notifications of new posts by email email address follow

digital nomad friendly cities.description: Yesterday, The Portal,¬†a public¬†technology sculpture arrived in New York City and Dublin. Serving as a virtual bridge, the installation will transmit a real-time unfiltered live stream of both citi‚Ä¶
digital nomad friendly cities.content_preview: yesterdaythe portala publictechnology sculpture arrived in new york city and dublin serving as a virtual bridge the installation will transmit a real time unfiltered live stream of both cities transcending physical barriers and putting new yorkers and dubliners instantly in touch created by lithuani...
digital nomad friendly cities.full_content: yesterdaythe portala publictechnology sculpture arrived in new york city and dublin serving as a virtual bridge the installation will transmit a real time unfiltered live stream of both cities transcending physical barriers and putting new yorkers and dubliners instantly in touch created by lithuanian artist and entrepreneur benediktas gylysthe portalis a group project bringing together countries cities governments and people to connect cities with these technological art installations the first iteration was launched in 2021 with portals linking vilnius lublin as of yesterday morning the new york city and dublin portals were live allowing folks 3000 miles apart to see city life on the other side of the atlantic ocean in new york citythe portalis installed at the landmark flatiron building at one of the citys most dynamic intersections between broadway fifth avenue and 23rd street in dublin the sculpture will be installed on oconnell street the citys heart this location will capture dublins gpo building and the spire on view will be identical circular concrete sculptures with a round screen at its center allowing human connection across borders through a video call like projection bringing the vision to life was a coordinated collaboration between the flatiron nomad partnership the simons foundation the new york city department of transportations art program nyc dot art and the city of dublin Œ¥ this site uses akismet to reduce spamlearn how your comment data is processed enter your email address to subscribe to this blog and receive notifications of new posts by email email address subscribe

underrated cities in france.page_title: The Most Underrated Destinations in Europe You Should Visit ‚Äì Mark's Travel Journal
underrated cities in france.description: Visiting some of the most underrated destinations in Europe is one of the most unique experiences you‚Äôll ever have.
underrated cities in france.content_preview: travel experience when planning a trip to europe its easy to get swept up in the allure of famous landmarks and popular tourist destinations however some of the continents most incredible treasuresremain hidden in plain sightovershadowed by their more renowned counterparts these underrated destinati...
underrated cities in france.full_content: travel experience when planning a trip to europe its easy to get swept up in the allure of famous landmarks and popular tourist destinations however some of the continents most incredible treasuresremain hidden in plain sightovershadowed by their more renowned counterparts these underrated destinations offer a chance to escape the crowds and delve into the authentic heart of europe these hidden gems are waiting to be discovered from charming towns tucked away in the countryside to coastal gems off the beaten path lets unlock the secrets of the most underrated destinations in europe unveiling their unique charms and captivating allure so if youre seeking an extraordinary adventure beyond the ordinary join us as we explore the less traveled roads and uncover the true hidden gems of europe nestled in the heart of italybologna is a wonderful destinationfor people seeking an authentic italian experience this hidden gem known for its rich history and stunning medieval architecture offers a delightful blend of old world charm and modern vibrancy as you wander through the citys narrow streetsbeautifully preserved buildings that transport you back in timewill enchant youdont miss the iconic two towers the symbol of bologna which provides panoramic city views indulge in the local cuisine including the famous bolognese sauce as you explore the bustling food markets and charming caf√©s although you should remember to ask forraguinstead of bolognese bolognas warm atmosphere and lesser known status make it a must visit destination for those looking to experience italy beyond the well trodden paths nestled in the picturesque czech countryside ƒçesk√Ω krumlov is a fairy tale destination that often flies under the radar this hidden gem transports visitors to a bygone era with its well preserved medieval architecture and enchanting atmosphere as you wander through its cobbled streets youll be captivated by the charm of the renaissance and baroque buildings that line the towns winding alleys dont miss the iconic ƒçesk√Ω krumlov castle a unesco world heritage site that offersbreathtaking views of the town and its surrounding countrysideenjoy the rich history and culture by visiting the egon schiele art centrum or taking a boat ride along the vltava river with its idyllic setting and timeless beauty ƒçesk√Ω krumlov is a must visit destination for travelers seeking an off the beaten path european experience scandinavia has many breathtaking landscapes and vibrant cities but one hidden gem people often underestimate alesund norway this coastal town on the west coast offers a picturesque setting with its art nouveau architecture and stunning fjords alesund is aparadise for outdoor enthusiastsoffering hiking trails that lead to panoramic viewpoints and opportunities for kayaking amidst the awe inspiring natural beauty enjoy the local culture by exploring the vibrant seafood markets and visiting the towns historical museums alesunds charm lies in its peaceful ambiance that makes it one of scandinavias best kept secrets andmost amazing travel destinations you shouldnt miss it during your european adventure in the heart of croatia lies a natural wonder that gets much less recognition than it should plitvice lakes national park this park is a paradise for nature lovers with cascading waterfalls crystal clear lakes and lush forests as you wander along the wooden pathways that wind through the park youll be mesmerized by the vibrant turquoise waters and the ethereal beauty surrounding you the lakes interconnected by numerous waterfalls create amagical landscape that seems taken from a fairy taleexplore the parks network of trails breathe in the fresh air and immerse yourself in the untouched wilderness plitvice lakes national park is a hidden gem that will leave you in awe of natures grandeur and reaffirm its status as one of the most underrated destinations in europe tucked away in the rugged region of basilicata italy matera is a hidden gem that often goes unnoticed by travelers with its fascinating history and unique charm this ancient city offers a glimpse into a world unlike any other materas claim to fame lies in its sassi a complex cave dwell network carved into the cliffs these captivating dwellings dating back thousands of years have earned matera the title the city of stones as you explore the winding streets and staircases youll be transported to a different erasurrounded by the timeless beauty of architecturemarvel at the rock cut churches visit the matera cathedral and soak in the breathtaking views from the belvedere viewpoint matera is a destination that showcases the resilience of human ingenuity and stands as a testament to the enduring spirit of this captivating city in the enchanting region of alsace france lies the charming town of colmar its a true gem that often escapes the tourist radar with its fairytale like ambiance and well preserved half timbered houses colmar exudes an undeniable old world charm stroll through the cobblestone streets where colorful flower filled canals wind through the towncreating a picture perfect settingthe towns rich history is evident in its architecture with buildings that blend french and german influences take a leisurely boat ride along the canals visit the renowned unterlinden museum or indulge in the exquisite alsatian cuisine at one of the local eateries while popular european capitals like paris and rome attract millions of tourists each year there are lesser known capitals that deserve equal attention tallinn the capital of estonia is a citysteeped in history with its well preserved medieval old townexplore the cobbled streets visit ancient churches and enjoy panoramic views from toompea hill alternatively head to ljubljana the capital of slovenia known for its vibrant cultural scene and charming architecture stroll along the ljubljanica river browse the local markets and visit the iconic ljubljana castle and dont forget to buy a locally made dragon figurine souvenir these offbeat capitals offer a refreshing change of pace theyll allow you to immerse yourself in the local culture and traditions as you plan your trip to these underrated destinations its essential to consider the practical aspects of long term travel packing efficiently and thoughtfully is crucial for a smooth and enjoyable journey pack versatile clothing suitable for different weather conditions and comfortable walking shoes additionally you should do your best to properly prioritize what you need to pack anddecide what to leave behind research the local customs and etiquette of the destinations you plan to visit that way you can ensure you can engage respectfully with the local community dont forget toarrange travel insuranceto protect yourself against unforeseen circumstances by preparing well and packing smart you can embark on your european adventure with peace of mind europes most underrated destinations offer many unique experiences for travelersseeking something off the beaten pathwhether youre exploring the romantic streets of bologna discovering the best kept secrets of scandinavia or uncovering hidden gems throughout europe these destinations will leave you with lasting memories whatever destination you choose its sure to be both an exciting journey anda romantic getaway your trip to the most underrated destinations in europe will be a truly unforgettable experience i love this europe has so much to offer and i think its so important to get a balance and see more of the underrated places too ƒçesk√Ω krumlov and ljubljana have both been on my list for years and youve convinced me to add bologna thank you so much for sharing bologna is great youll love it thanks for the comments my boyfriend and i were wondering where we could take the kids this summer i think youve given us all the info we need thanks for the insight glad i couldhelp thanks for reading pingbackeco friendly travel how to reduce your carbon footprint on the go marks travel journal pingbackeco friendly travel how to reduce your carbon footprint on the go plus travel group Œ¥ underrated cities in france.page_title: Most Underrated Destinations in South America ‚Äì Mark's Travel Journal
underrated cities in france.description: Here are some of the most underrated destinations in South America you should visit at least once in your life!
underrated cities in france.content_preview: travel experience south america has some of the most beautiful places on earth it is no surprise that it attracts so many tourists worldwide every year it consists of only twelve countries but each of them is equally charming and interesting in its own way some tourist locations on this continent ar...
underrated cities in france.full_content: travel experience south america has some of the most beautiful places on earth it is no surprise that it attracts so many tourists worldwide every year it consists of only twelve countries but each of them is equally charming and interesting in its own way some tourist locations on this continent are very well known such as the inca citadel machu picchu in peru the statue of christ christ the redeemer in brazil iguazu waterfalls in argentina and so much more but besides all these famous places there are so much less familiar destinations that are as gorgeous but not talked about enough we are here to show you the most underrated destinations in south america that you should check out if you love traveling los roques archipelago is one of south americas more expensive and lavish destinations it is perfect for various activities if you are looking for sandy beaches crystal clear water with lots of coral riffs for diving and snorkeling then this is a place to go this place is truly heaven on earth it is located in the caribbean sea not far away from the coast of venezuela and it has around 350 islands and numerous animal and plant species some of them which are endangered the main occupations for visitors are of course swimming and exploring marine life some people are fond of fishing which is very rewarding here since there are at least 270 species of fish kitesurfing and windsurfing are options as well there are only two ways to travel here by plane which is the way most people do it or by boat we should warn you that hotel accommodation is costly here but dont worry you could also camp here which can be a fun experience and it will ultimately cost cheaper you just need topack everything you may needand enjoy paraguay is a relatively small country located in the central part of the continent however it is a fantastic option to check out some unique destinations in south america not to mention that this country could be a good choice if you ever try to move internationally we know that moving to another continent can be very stressful and filled with anxiety but try tokeep a positive mindset there is no need to worry if you have made the right choice since paraguay is well known forits safetyand mild and pleasant climate have that in mind if you ever plan to move there as for its capital asuncion located on the banks of the paraguay river is filled with exciting content here are some examples the seat of the government of paraguay palacio de lopez is a beautiful construction that is even more extravagant at night when all the lights come on and if you are an art lover asuncions art museums are must visit places there are various museo del barro museo de bellas artes museo de arte sacro fundacion texo etc and if you love animals and nature we suggest visiting the botanical garden and zoo of asuncion or the delightful crystal fall located in the jungle area the colorful city of valpara√≠so is a must see if you are visiting chile it is located about 80 miles northwest of the much more known country capital santiago it is the countrys cultural center famous for its street art brightly colored houses and seaside views resembling someeuropean cities in 2003 the town was placed on unescos world heritage list poet pablo neruda one of its most famous inhabitants often described it as beautiful chaos partly because of its specific geography between a mountain range and the ocean the city is a maze of steep inclines narrow streets and staircases making some city landmarks reachable only by foot or funicular so be prepared for a lot of walking that will finally pay off because this is one of those places where if you like photography you will not put your camera down for a second plus you can treat yourself towine tours of chileas a reward for all your hard work when it comes to sightseeing peru has a rich pre hispanic culture wild nature and world famous gastronomy that is why it is one of the favorite destinations in south america for tourists but there is much more than machu picchu and cuzco although it gets only ten percent of overall international tourist visits in peru the city of trujillo is an excellent example of an unjustly underrated destination in south america at least for those interested in pre columbian culture and heritage and not fond of high altitudes and the problems it brings near the city lies chan chan the largest mud city in the ancient world and the capital of chimu culture the site is a world heritage site some 25 miles south of trujillo is another important archeological site las huacas del sol y de la luna which is very interesting to visit huanchaco spa is another place you should not miss another location in peru that deserves your attention is iquitos it is the capital of the mayan province people also know it as the capital of the peruvian amazon iquitos is the largest city in the world that isnt connected to any other by road the only way to access it is either by boat or plane and that is part of its charm lush nature and the multitude of animals that live in a nearby jungle draw in the tourists who visit iquitos choose one of the boat tours that can take you to one of the protected natural areas in the amazon visit the local community of indigenous people or take a night time hike in the jungle these will befun adventuresthat youll remember fondly be sure to try local or international dishes in the iron house constructed by gustav eiffel there is a reason why popular places are popular but it doesnt mean that those less known are not beautiful if you love traveling we urge you to consider visiting these underrated destinations in south america see some other cultures try new food and enjoy your visit to the fullest i havent heard of these places but they all sound like great destinations to visit they all sound like they have a lot to offer thank you for sharing your list suggestions lauren reblogged this onfood explora its a coincidence that you mentioned belize briefly i just finished watching a youtube about a jamaican who now resides in belize belize appears to be calling my name these are some intriguing south american vacation spots thank you for sharing pingbacklaid back vacations for older adults marks travel journal Œ¥ enter your email address to follow this blog and receive notifications of new posts by email email address follow

underrated cities in france.content_preview: everything is close in europe so i took advantage of 10 days off during the christmas period to travel with another friend with wanderlust to 4 european capital cities bratislava vienna prague and finally berlin tiring but very nice and cold experience bratislava 2 days were enough to visit the char...
underrated cities in france.full_content: everything is close in europe so i took advantage of 10 days off during the christmas period to travel with another friend with wanderlust to 4 european capital cities bratislava vienna prague and finally berlin tiring but very nice and cold experience bratislava 2 days were enough to visit the charming especially with the snow but rather small slovak capital here are the main attractions vienna one hour and a half after leaving from bratislava we arrived in vienna vienna was clearly the highlight of our trip it is clearly an underrated city that is worth a visit we had only planned to stay there 2 days but i would advise to stay at least 4 days here is what we had time to do prague we took a 4 hour bus ride to arrive in the czech capital on the 30th december and spend new years eve there i must admit this time of the year was probably not the perfect one to discover prague or maybe any city in fact the streets were all very crowded here are the highlights of our short visit berlin another bus ride to arrive in the last stop of our christmas trip berlin we had planned to stay there a bit more than 3 days of course it was not enough to see everything but by this time we were pretty tired here are our key moments in the german capital time to fly back to brussels ill go back to vienna and berlin for sure Œ¥ this site uses akismet to reduce spamlearn how your comment data is processed
